intro: Endocles, commonly known as the African daisy, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It is native to southern Africa and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers that range in color from white to yellow. The plants typically have a basal rosette of leaves and are often found in rocky or sandy soils. Endocles species are generally drought-tolerant and can thrive in full sun. They are popular in gardens for their ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
